Problem:
class AirConditioner { constructor(powerState, temperature) { this.isOn = powerState; this.temperature = temperature; }  setTemperature(newTemp) { if (this.isOn && newTemp >= 16 && newTemp <= 30) { this.temperature = newTemp; } } togglePower() { this.isOn = !this.isOn; if (!this.isOn) { this.temperature = null; } } }",

If the air conditioner's power is turned on and a setTemperature(25) method is called, will the temperature be set to 25?
Explanation: Turning the air conditioner on sets `this.isOn` to true. Subsequent call to setTemperature with a valid temperature within the allowed range (16-30 degrees) successfully updates the temperature to 25 due to the temperature setting conditions being met.
